title: [RELEASE] 2.14.1
body:
### TASKS:
 - [x] [DEV] Only show the server version warning splash screen if one of the connected accounts is an old server
 - [x] [DEV] Only show the Android 4.4 deprecation warning splash screen if the device is affected
 - [x] [GIT] Create branch `release_1.0.4.1` in owncloud/android-library from master
 - [x] [GIT] Create branch `release_2.14.1` in owncloud/android from master
 - [x] [DEV] Update version number and name in build.gradle in owncloudComLibrary module
 - [x] [DIS] Create changelog file (< 500 chars) and add to CHANGELOG.md in owncloud/android
 - [x] [QA] Design Test plan
 - [x] [QA] Regression Test plan
 - [x] [DIS] Generate test APK file from `release_2.14.1` branch in owncloud/android

 - [x] [QA] Perform some minor tests in the final apk, including an update from previous version.
 - [x] [DIS] Create new release on Github Android repository
 - [x] [DIS] Upload & publish release APK and changelog in Play Store
 - [x] [DIS] Update screenshots and store listing, if needed, in Play Store
 - [x] [GIT] Merge branch `release_1.0.4.1` in owncloud/android-library, into master
 - [x] [GIT] Merge branch `release_2.14.1` in owncloud/android, into master
 - [x] [GIT] merge `release_1.0.4.1` branch into stable, in owncloud/android-library

- Library: https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/290

title: [BUG] Chunked uploads appear as uploaded even with no creation permission
body:
This comes from https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2727#issuecomment-565347829

### Actual behaviour
- File starts to upload. Finally, in uploads view appears as completed but file is not in the file list.

### Expected behaviour
- Permission error in both notification and uploads view.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. User1 shares a folder with User2, with no "create" permission
2. User2 uploads a file bigger than 1MB inside the shared folder

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? Yes
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)

### Environment data
Android version: 7
Device model: Nexus 6P

ownCloud app version: 2.14

title: Remove "Delete merged branch" bot
body:
From its [Readme](https://github.com/SvanBoxel/delete-merged-branch):

> You may not need this app as GitHub recently added this feature natively to their platform. It allows you to automatically delete the head branch after a merge. If you need more advanced controls and configuration settings, this app is still well suited for the job.

Since you don't have a `.github/delete-merged-branch-config.yml` file in the repo, there's no advanced config.

https://help.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/managing-the-automatic-deletion-of-branches

title: [SPIKE] AppAuth as OAuth2 / OIDC (OpenId Connect) support library
body:
The target here is checking which is the best option to integrate OAuth/OIDC support in the Android app.

- Things to check:
   - [x] OIDC
     - Basic OIDC explanation: https://developer.okta.com/blog/2019/10/21/illustrated-guide-to-oauth-and-oidc (got it from [this docs issue](https://github.com/owncloud/docs/issues/2100#issue-526458351))
      - OIDC for ownCloud: https://github.com/owncloud/openidconnect
   - [x] App Auth library
      - Check if we could replace our current OAuth implementation (custom) with the [AppAuth one](https://github.com/openid/AppAuth-Android).
      - Examples:
         - Codelab: https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/appauth-android-codelab/#0
         - AppAuth Android demo app: https://github.com/openid/AppAuth-Android/tree/master/app
   - [ ] Any POC?

- Considerations:
   - The `id token` is not needed for now, the access token is enough. The id token will be important when it comes to using extended features like sign out

- +Info in https://github.com/owncloud/openidconnect#openid-connect-for-owncloud
- Easily fire up an owncloud server with an open id connect provider https://github.com/owncloud/openidconnect/tree/master/tests/docker

title: [New arch] Adapt tests on Bitrise to be executed in different modules
body:
This is all I've tried so far:

- Using **Virtual Device Testing** plugin: 
  - Execute instrumented tests for ownCloudApp and ownCloud Domain modules in the same Bitrise workflow. Not possible, I already wrote there => https://discuss.bitrise.io/t/allow-multiple-android-vdt-step-invocations/ :x:
   - Launch multiple Bitrise workflows with the same trigger, i.e. a push event on a branch launch instrumented tests from different modules. Not possible => https://discuss.bitrise.io/t/parallel-builds-trigger-multiple-workflows-builds-at-the-same-time-build-stages-fan-out-fan-in-support/410 :x:
  - Launch a workflow just after other one, discussion in https://discuss.bitrise.io/t/allow-multiple-android-vdt-step-invocations/6758/9?u=davigonz :interrobang:
  - Create two separate apps: one for executing unit tests in all modules and instrumented tests in app module, and other one for executing instrumented tests in data module. ✅ 
- Creating an **emulator on our own**:
  - With API 26, Bitrise is able to run an emulator with the tests but most of the tests do not pass due to some mockk limitations when executing tests on < P Android devices => https://mockk.io/ANDROID.html. I've tried with [dexopener library](https://github.com/tmurakami/dexopener), as Mockk guys suggest but it doesn't work either.  :x:
   - With API 28, Bitrise is not able to run an emulator. Bitrise guys sent me some scripts to do it but they don't end up working  :interrobang:

title: [Xodo] Changed pdf file uploaded, but seemingly not changed on server
body:
### Actual behaviour
When downloading a pdf within the android app and changing it with Xodo reader, then pressing the sync button, an upload bar will display as usual, but at the end, the time stamp of the file is still the same and on other devices, where no syncing happens. When opening the file from within owncloud app, the changes made in Xodo do appear. When file is deleted locally and downloaded again, the changes made do not appear in the "new" file from the server.

### Expected behaviour
(a) Either there is a bug with Xodo, which saves the altered file in a different folder. However, if the actual file within the owncloud-folder wasn't changed, I'd expect a message, though, right?
or
(b) If Xodo does in fact apply the changes to the right file, the timestamp should change after the upload and the syncing should effect the other devices.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: Samsung Note 8

Stock or customized system: Lineage 14.1

ownCloud app version: 2.13.1 release 6a5f775cf [via FDroid]

ownCloud server version: 10.3.0.4

title: Ignore flaky tests
body:
Ignore flaky tests to check a better way to implement. Those test check that an activity is finished after clicking a dismiss button, but the assertion is being checked before the activity is finally finished. The tests are not covering any important part of the app, so, if no better solution is found out, they will be removed.

@abelgardep @davigonz

title: [BUG] Open xls-files or doc-files with Docs to Go
body:
### Actual behaviour
- I open a file with owncloud-client and it is opened in "Doc to Go". I have a non-root device Samsung Galaxy S7 with Android 8. When I want to safe the file, it is not saved in the owncloud area. Doc to Go asks for giving another location, I can only save it to a local directory on the android device. If I then again open the file in owncloud it is the status before the save in Doc to Go. It is not saved to a folder of owncloud so the file in owncloud is not uploaded.

### Expected behaviour
- If I press save in Doc to Go the data should be in owncloud and synced to the owncloud-server.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open Owncloud-client on Android Smartphone
2. select an office-document like an xls-file
3. open it. and try to get the changes saved automatically to owncloud.


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)

yes

### Environment data
Android version: 8.0.0

Device model: Galaxy S7 SM-G930F

Stock or customized system: custom system from samsung

ownCloud app version: 2.13.1 release 6a5f775cf

ownCloud server version: 10.3.0

### Logs

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
{"reqId":"4fa428cb-bbc9-4a01-abe4-e394d6c75059","level":0,"time":"2019-12-04T00:04:02+00:00","remoteAddr":"192.168.154.254","user":"boerns","app":"OC\\Authentication\\Token\\DefaultTokenProvider::updateToken","method":"PROPFIND","url":"\/owncloud\/remote.php\/dav\/files\/boerns\/","message":"updating token 2585, last check is now 1575410130"}

{"reqId":"39c9a8d6-da52-4b6c-898b-8c212130f374","level":0,"time":"2019-12-04T00:04:09+00:00","remoteAddr":"192.168.158.169","user":"boerns","app":"OC\\Authentication\\Token\\DefaultTokenProvider::updateToken","method":"PROPFIND","url":"\/owncloud\/remote.php\/dav\/files\/boerns\/Ausgaben.xls","message":"updating token 2595, last check is now 1575417722"}

title: Short user names / group names are not found as recipients
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1.  In `config.php` set  `user.search_min_length' => 4`,
2. Create a user called `123` and a group called `456`
3. Try to share an item with them 

### Actual behaviour
Not posible, so they do not reach the 4 characters needed to start searching

### Expected behaviour
They should be posible to share with.

After checking the web UI and desktop client, they follow the value of `user.search_min_length` but in case there is a shorter-name recipient that matches the typed pattern, they show it. This is, repeating the steps 1. and 2. above:

3. Type `123`  (or `456`)

Current: `123` (or `456`) is shown in the list, even when its length does not reach the minimum in `config.php`.

Xiaomi MiA2 , Android 9
oC 10.3

title: remove twice log
body:
No need fom `Timber.plant(DebugTree(Log_OC::class.java))`
because
`Timber.plant(FileLoggingTree(...))`
is enough

title: [BUG] Authentication info lost. Authentication failed. Auth retry does not end
body:
### Actual behaviour
I see that file edits on my android do not get synced any more (they do not appear on my Windows Desktop). I open the android app on the phone to see what is going on. The app shows: authentication failed. I touch the provided "edit account"(my own translation from German app) and enter my password again. App shows that it it tries to log in... and does not get to an end for minutes. Neither success nor fail, just spinning...  I close the app and try again. Problem repeats. Stays that way for a few days. I even lose a file that I created on my android and that is gone now.

Now during bug reporting I try again several times. After trying like 5 times and turning the phone down for several minutes and then picking it up it suddenly authenticated.

In the months prior: (history of the problem, may not be relevant) the app already did ask to authenticate again, but succeeded. Like every few days or several times a day. In fact it seemed to be the behavior as in https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2356 , but that is just my impression. And then in worsened for me so that I could not log in any more. hence the bug report.


### Expected behaviour
- app does not lose my auth info
- app, if it loses my auth info, is able to log me in again after I re-enter my password (I tried via laptop browser successfully, so server seems to be fine. using same wifi as android, so internet connection seems fine)
- app, if not able to log me in again, does not keep on spinning for minutes but tells me what the problem is

### Steps to reproduce
Those would be nice, but it does not happen consistently. suddenly the app cannot log in.

### Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
Good idea, but right now it works anyway.

### Environment data
Android version: 10

Device model: google pixel 3a

Stock or customized system: stock. bought it, accepted the upgrade to android 10 that the phone offered me.

ownCloud app version: v2.13.1 release 6a5f775cf ... found this after a long time in settings. Why settings! the version is not a setting, is it!

ownCloud server version: version.php has ...

$OC_Version = array(10,0,10,4);
$OC_VersionString = '10.0.10';
$OC_Edition = '';
$OC_Channel = 'stable';
$OC_VersionCanBeUpgradedFrom = [[8,2,11],[9,0,9],[9,1]];
$OC_Build = '2018-09-17T11:07:09+00:00 097d4d22e0cf3341c4923e26453efb32ddedfb24';


### Logs
#### Web server error log
I would give it to you, but how can I be sure that it does not include security tokens? It does contain strings like "requesttoken" and strings that are part of so many lines that they could be a validation that the browser sends with most request.

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
After quite some time I realized that you do not refer to a URL path but a file path. I suggest that you make that clearer in the instructions.

I would give it to you, but how can I be sure that it does not include some security token?

title: Reduce logging in ChunkFromFileRequestBody
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I wanted to track down a bug while uploading a video (The video upload was canceled with "Unknown error". Now it doesn't appear again), but I only see the following three messages over a dozen of times per second. This makes the log viewer in Android Studio unusable.
````
2019-11-30 11:53:51.628 22964-16558/com.owncloud.android D/ChunkFromFileRequestBody: Read 4096 bytes from file channel to java.nio.HeapByteBuffer[pos=4096 lim=4096 cap=4096]
2019-11-30 11:53:51.631 22964-16558/com.owncloud.android D/ChunkFromFileRequestBody: Write 4096 bytes to sink buffer with size 0
2019-11-30 11:53:51.631 22964-16558/com.owncloud.android D/ChunkFromFileRequestBody: Sink buffer size: 0
````

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Remove the logging from there.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Make the logging debug version only.

### TASKS

- [ ] Research (if needed)
- [ ] Create branch feature/feature_name
- [ ] Development tasks
  - [ ] Implement whatever
  - [ ] ...
- [ ] Code review and apply changes requested
- [ ] Design test plan
- [ ] QA
- [ ] Merge branch feature/feature_name into master

### PR

- App: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2764
- Library (if needed): https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/284

title: Whole UI and UX redesign (ownCloud app for Android 3.0?) [WIP]
body:
[Changes under the hood](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2351) are necessary but... 

Mobile devices and Android itself are evolving very fast, with larger screens, new user interface patterns, new ways to interact with options... and the ownCloud app for Android is lagging behind in this aspect. I would say that there's at least three key topics to address on this matter:

- The app has the same aspect as many old apps that implemented the material design when it was released for the first time.
- Many options are mainly concentrated at the top of the screen, so with the big size of current devices is harder to reach that part of the screen with just one hand.
- Some primary options are a bit hidden, such as files searching, files sorting and switching between grid or list view.

Following this approach, I've started to work on some new UI / UX concepts for the ownCloud app for Android.

## 1. Filelist

| Old filelist | New filelist |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ![old_filelist](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/69874634-c74b3300-12bb-11ea-83f2-62522669358f.png) | ![Filelist (resized)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74660679-e0ff6680-5196-11ea-84c9-05e881426945.png) | 

| New filelist | New filelist (dark) |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ![Filelist](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74660452-72220d80-5196-11ea-9069-37fdbbfcc734.png) | ![New filelist dark](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74233122-67650580-4cca-11ea-989e-f04774a0003c.png) |

- Changes (from top to bottom):
   - **New search bar**, automatically shown without pressing lens icon.
   - **Sort alphabetically, by date or size just above the files**, along with a **small arrow** to make the sorting ascending or descending.
   - **Grid or list view above the files** as well.
   - **Three dots for every file**, in the same row. Tapping this three dots icon will open a bottom menu with the same options that were before in the three dots icon at the top of the view (more difficult to reach with one hand)
   - **New bottom navigation bar** to move between Files, Uploads, Av. offline and Shared by link options, more accessible for the users. These 4 options will no longer appear in the side menu.
  
Note: all the new views will have their respective dark theme versions, related to https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2512

## 2. Sidemenu

| Old sidemenu | New sidemenu |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ![Old sidemenu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74228273-6c24bc00-4cc0-11ea-9bf3-d485a419a39b.png) | ![Sidemenu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74229130-105b3280-4cc2-11ea-9cb7-0a60944548c0.png) | 

| New sidemenu | New sidemenu (dark) |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ![Sidemenu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74229130-105b3280-4cc2-11ea-9cb7-0a60944548c0.png) | ![Sidemenu (dark)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74237097-07269180-4cd3-11ea-8a4e-62277933fb7f.png) |

- Changes:

  - **Account management removed** from side menu.
  - Files, Uploads, Av. offline and Shared by link will no longer appear either, just **Settings, Feedback and Help options as well as user quota**.

## 3. Account management

| Old account handling | New account handling |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ![Old account handling](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74653151-e2756280-5187-11ea-8041-0d2e9ba282f9.png) | ![Account handling](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74652595-aa215480-5186-11ea-9c26-7c5aa7584971.png) |

## More views...

All opinions and suggestions are welcome

CC / @michaelstingl @jesmrec @abelgardep @ChrisEdS

title: Proposal of automatic versionname, just with taging it
body: (cherry picked from commit 159b88260a80b4c35af3342cf6c7323e0749c2b5) To not differ too much from my fork, I make this proposal, to get rid of manual version change in code. Simply tag it, and the last used tag will be used as `versionName`

title: Get rid of Android 4.4 support
body:
Android 4.4 was released long time ago (31st October 2013) and we are still maintaining some parts of the code to support it. Taking into account the oC users using this version, not that many, we could upgrade the minimum version to Android 5.0 (Lollipop)

### PR
- App #2748 
- Library https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/285

title: Adjustments in Settings UI tests to avoid flakyness
body:
Issues: #2732 #2709

Some actions performed:

- Camera Uploads section:

For these tests, the whole preferences activity was loaded, taking advantage that the section is on the top (visible at a glance). Some tests were flaky because the activity takes a bit longer in loading, before the action over the camera uploads checkbox is done (this is something not desirable that the testing framework should take care). Therefore, the dialog warning users to set up correctly the camera uploads is not displayed, failing the matcher over the "OK" button.

As fix, the activity is only loaded with the camera uploads section. 

- LocalFolderPicker activity

Here, the fix is a bit hacky. An implicit wait till the UI componentes are visible to launch the tests. Although there is a loop, it will not be infinite since the `activityRule` always is created.

- Passcode

The test for cancelling the activity was removed. It was being flaky due to `isFinishing` assertion. Such test is not a critical one (too far from this.. it only checks that a cancelled view is dismissed). So, better to get rid of.

These fixes were tested with:

- Samsung Galaxy S9, Android 9
- Nexus 6P , Android 7
- Huawei P20 Lite, Android 9

Currently it's obvious disabled, because on master it fails ! **Please enable lint check on CI** With this pull request you see in root the lint report `lint-app-report.html` Btw, a lot of them should be solved later on, and after that step, you should prevent them in the future by `severity="error"` in _lint.xml_

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Avoid sharing items not allowed
body:
Detected during testing server 10.3.2 version.

The specific scenario is:

1. Add `'share_folder' => '/ReceivedShares'`  to `config.php`. All the shares you receive will be added to such folder
2. Share an item to enforce the creation of the folder

This folder (by definition) is not allowed to be shared. Its permissions in `PROPFIND` response:

`<oc:permissions>NVCK</oc:permissions>`

As you see, the sharing permission (R) is not allowed.

However, you can select it, select a recipient to share with, and finally you got an error:

`Path contains file shared with you`

As improvement, if an item does not have the sharing permission, the share action should be hidden, as well as, for example, we do with shared items when re-sharing is not allowed.

title: [TESTING] Setting tests flakiness
body:
I was working on #2728 and at some point, I executed all the tests to check that are working as expected and noticed that some of the tests related to settings seem to be a bit flaky. I switched to master branch and try it there again but the result is pretty similar, could you check them @jesmrec ? 

- 1st execution, 5 tests failing:

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Logging with Timber
body:
Contribution by @hannesa2 

It's about to change logging from self-made to [Timber](https://github.com/JakeWharton/timber).

It removes the logic to display log and simply uses a Fragment from logging-lib.

It keeps all previous functions like 
* searching

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3314607/68044868-82da7080-fcd8-11e9-9049-b6f6e338c685.png)

and adds 
* a tab for ownCloud Filelogging view
* a tab for Logcat view 
    * to see what happens on other processes too
    * to log what ownCloud forgot to log
    * within `release` build type !
* share log
* adds filter for `Verbose`, `Debug`, `Info`, `Warning`, `Error` 

Eg, when you select `Info` you will see only `Info`, `Warning`, `Error` entries and filters out `Verbose`, `Debug`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3314607/68045008-d77deb80-fcd8-11e9-8b6d-76e3bf6f2aeb.png)

So it helps to investigate, what's wrong with ownCloud.

All is encapsulated with a logging lib which I use in several places.
**I kept to old Log_OC** , to easy migrate and do not touch all files. Especially when you do a huge refactoring

One major advantage for developers:
Before:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3314607/68023509-94575480-fca7-11e9-8a48-ea105420bd25.png)


**NEW**:  you can **click log log line** and jump direct to code ! You see the linenumber as well

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3314607/68023537-b2bd5000-fca7-11e9-96c2-d5d10739731b.png)


### PR

- App #2725 (Previously #2694)
- Library https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/283 (Previously https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/275)

title: Ignore "Second Try incorrect" test
body:
The UI test `secondTryIncorrect` in the passcode suite has been failing. 

The problem is that one of the assertions in the test check the error message in the snackbar when the second try does not match the first one. But, this happens when the softkeyboard is on the front, so the `isDisplayed()` assertion returns false.

This fix needs some elaboration to make the test pass, so, an `@Ignore` annotation is temporarily set, and new issue is created:  https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2722

@davigonz @abelgardep

title: [FIX] Fix change device language leads to new image folder name

When changing the device language in Android app the whole configuration changes, too. The problem here is for example that a new directory for image uploads will create.
This means that all images will be uploaded again.

Fix for https://github.com/owncloud/enterprise/issues/3523

title: [New arch] Use Moshi to parse capabilities and get rid of RemoteCapability in library?
body:
[`GetRemoteCapabilitiesOperation.kt`](https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/blob/master/owncloudComLibrary/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/lib/resources/status/GetRemoteCapabilitiesOperation.kt) takes care of parsing the capabilities retrieved from the server in JSON format and transform them into RemoteCapability object.

Similarly to what we detailed in https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2704, we could use Moshi to make the parsing of capabilities.

#### IN ADDITION

Since RemoteCapability object and OCCapability (domain model)  objects are going to represent basically the same (when [modularization](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2607) is finished), we could get rid of `RemoteCapability` and parse the JSON directly to `OCCapability` from the data layer.

Parsing JSON and transforming it to domain models in data layer is the most common scenario when connecting with external APIs but ownCloud for Android is a special case, we have an intermediate layer between the oC server and our app, which is the ownCloud Android Library. This library is meant to make the life easier to those interested in communicate an Android app with ownCloud servers. 

If we remove `RemoteCapability` from the ownCloud Android Library, the apps using it will receive just JSON and would need to parse it, so maybe is not the best idea if the aim of the library is "integrating your Android application with ownCloud seamlessly." 🤔 

Tasks:

- [ ] Move capabilities parsing from library to data layer, that will parse the JSON and transform it into OCCapability object. This OCCapability object is the domain model that will be retrieved from the data layer.
- [ ] Get rid of RemoteCapability class in library since is basically the same as OCCapability

### PR
- App: #2860 
- Library: https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/298

title: Resize cloud image from drawer menu
body: Some time ago we decided to include a cloud image in the side menu, starting with 2.8. As we detailed in https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2204 we made this to avoid the impression as if the app is not ready yet. Since then, we have added to the drawer menu an Available offline option and a new one, Shared by link, is coming. So the cloud image doesn't look that good now and it could be removed in my opinion. [](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/68774021-c87a3000-062c-11ea-9630-7a83185bdd29.png) ### PRs: - App: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2739

title: Better logging GUI
body:
It's about to change logging from self-made to [Timber](https://github.com/JakeWharton/timber).
This PR is the GUI part from https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/275 and it relies on it.

It removes the logic to display log and simply uses a Fragment from logging-lib.

It keeps all previous functions like 
* searching

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3314607/68044868-82da7080-fcd8-11e9-9049-b6f6e338c685.png)

and adds 
* a tab for ownCloud Filelogging view
* a tab for Logcat view 
    * to see what happens on other processes too
    * to log what ownCloud forgot to log
    * within `release` build type !
* share log
* adds filter for `Verbose`, `Debug`, `Info`, `Warning`, `Error` 

Eg, when you select `Info` you will see only `Info`, `Warning`, `Error` entries and filters out `Verbose`, `Debug`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3314607/68045008-d77deb80-fcd8-11e9-8b6d-76e3bf6f2aeb.png)

So it helps to investigate, what's wrong with ownCloud.

Btw, I recommend to add Firebase Crashlytics in ownCloud. If you want, I can help you with this task

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Recurse subfolders on photo/video uploads
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Google camera makes new folder for each burst or portrait shot, so these kind of shots never gets uploaded because they are not directly in camera folder defined in settings. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Owncloud photo/video upload feature should add a "recurse subfolders" option next to camera folder.

title: [BUG] 2FA can't authorize Android app
body:
**### Actual behaviour**
I set up OAuth2+TOTP apps in ownCloud settings. Then, I am able to successfully authorize the Desktop app on Windows (after I enter my 2FA code in the browser, I close the browser and the desktop clients works). 

The Android app, though, cannot get authorized. After I successfully login via the embedded webbrowser in the Android app (because after login, ownCloud clearly recognizes my name when it wants me to authorize access), the whole procedure fails as it takes me back to the username/password login form with explanation “Wrong username or password”.

**### Expected behaviour**
After writing the 2FA code in Android app's embedded webbrowser, I should be presented with a text such as "successfully authorized Android client" or similar; instead, I am shown "Wrong username or password", i.e. being taken back to the login form after successfully entering username+password and 2FA code. Clearly the login was successful, because my name and surname (account label) are shown in the webpage at the form, yet something makes ownCloud think I can't login.
 
**### Steps to reproduce**
1. enable OAuth2 app (v0.4.1) in ownCloud settings
2. enable TOTP app (2-Factor Authentication - tried on both v0.6.0 and v0.6.1) in ownCloud settings
3. (verify setup by successfully activating a Windows desktop ownCloud client, which works)
4. try to login on Android app (or even remove account and re-add it - it does not work, it's the same)
5. after entering username, password and 6-number 2FA code, it takes me back to ownCloud login screen (in the embedded webbrowser) saying “Wrong username or password”.
6. the Android app actually gets listed under /index.php/settings/personal?sectionid=security#oauth2 but the app itself does not move on from the failed login screen.

**Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?**
No, as the test:test does not have administrative permissions and TOTP+OAuth2 apps are not installed.


**### Environment data**
Android version: MIUI Global 10.3.6 (Android 9)
Device model: Xiaomi Mi MIX 2S
Stock or customized system: stock ROM (OTA)
ownCloud app version: v2.13.1
ownCloud server version: tried on both v10.2.1 (stable) and v10.3.0 (stable)
Additional apps: OAuth2 app v0.4.1, 2-Factor Authentication app either v0.6.0 or v0.6.1

**### Logs**
#### Web server error log
(not provided)

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
(not provided ... the log file is 1.5GB, why is there no log rotation? I can't open it :full_moon_with_face:)

title: [BUG] Apk file handling
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Store a correct apk inside an oC account
2. Tap to Download / Select "Open with"

### Actual behaviour
Nothing happens, neither downloading, nor "opening" with

### Expected behaviour
App must react to the user event. Options:

- If feasible, trigger the system installation wizard, so the apk started to install in case it is trusted and the system settings allow it
- Show an error, in case it is not posible to open. Specific formats like xsl or tar.gz implement also such behaviour
 

### Environment data
Android version: Reproducible with Android 9. Not reproducible with Android 7.

Device model:  Reproducible with MiA2 (v9), Huawei P20 (v9). Not reproducible with Nexus6P (v7)

ownCloud app version: 2.13.1

ownCloud server version: 10.3

CC @PVince81

title: [BUG] Files whose names differ only in case may point to the same one when available offline
body:
### Actual behaviour
The files whose names differ only in case refer to the same one if they are set to available offline.

### Expected behaviour
We can keep files whose names differ only in case at the same time.
If can't, we should be warned
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. upload a picture file named 'A_1121.jpg', and set it to 'available offline'
2. upload another picture file named 'a_1121.jpg', and set it to 'available offline'
3. swipe to synchronize the two files
4. then the two files all refer to the latter 'a_1121.jpg', and the 'A_1121.jpg' is lost! And sometimes in the file list, the thumbnails refer to two different files (ok) while after clicking into them the detailed contents are the same(wrong).  Sometimes thumbnails and the detailed contents are all the same (wrong).
I also find that in the local storage only file 'a_1121.jpg' is saved.


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
Yes, I've tried with the official owncloud server.
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)


### Environment data
Android version:
6.1.1
Device model: 
samsung s6 edge
ownCloud app version:
2.13.1
ownCloud server version:
10.3.0
### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
Insert your ownCloud log here
```

title: remove pointless comments
body:
especially where I'm the last changed user and git blame points to me.

It's just noise

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Additional nuance for download indicator when local file is out of date
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When a file is not mark as available offline but downloaded locally, it receives a green download indicator. When done once this is fine.
However when the file has changed on the server, I see the mtime change to "a few seconds ago" but the indicator is still green. This many times led me to believe that the file was downloaded already when it wasn't. Also I forgot to mark this file as "available offline" and forgot that an auto-synced file has a pink indicator.

More context: normally one could argue that if I tap the file to open it then it would sync anyway. In my use case it was an APK file which I cannot open through the mobile client for some reason, so I had to resort to an external file manager to open it there. So at the time where I saw that the mtime changed I assumed that the file synced and then switched to the external file manager to install the APK.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Whenever the local file is different from the remote file, I suggest to use a different indicator.
Maybe the indicator could become gray or green but transparent.
The indicator should clearly convey the idea that the files are different and a manual sync might be necessary.
Apart from the reason stated in my "more context" above, I think a user might be preparing from an offline trip and wants to make sure that his important files were already synced (but ones not marked as available offline). They might see the green indicator and believe that they are up to date when they aren't.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None. Well, or always mark files as available offline.
Or maybe have an option that whenever I open a file through the client it automatically becomes always available offline so that I never run into the green indicator issue.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.


### TASKS

- [ ] Research (if needed): UX research, visual solution ?
- [ ] Create branch feature/feature_name
- [ ] Development tasks
  - [ ] Implement whatever
  - [ ] ...
- [ ] Code review and apply changes requested
- [ ] Design test plan
- [ ] QA
- [ ] Merge branch feature/feature_name into master

### PR

- App
- Library (if needed)

title: Remove the build-artifacts Drone step
body: This step has been shown to dramatically lengthen build times. As it's just an output of the generated content, it's not strictly necessary, so is being removed.

title: [BUG] app loses OAuth2 token when app is closed
body:
### Actual behaviour
Every time I close the app and open it again, it asks me to re-authenticate. Automated uploads in the background also fail after I close the app, with a notification: "Upload error, you need to log in again - wrong username or password"

### Expected behaviour
The app should stay authenticated in the background.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. login to an ownCloud account with OAuth2
2. close the app. **edit:** and wait for 90 minutes
3. open the app again
4. see the warning message at the bottom


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? **no**
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)


### Environment data
This does not only happen with my device, many of my friends have this problem.

Android version: 7.1.2 (LineageOS 14.1-20190302-i9300)

Device model: gt-i9300

Stock or customized system: custom

ownCloud app version: 2.13.1

ownCloud server version: 10.0.10 - 10.3.1

OAuth2 app version: 0.4.1

title: [BUG] Crash when only starting the app (OnePlus One, LineageOS, F-Droid)
body:
### Actual behaviour
- App crashes instantly after opening it. No interaction possible

### Expected behaviour
- Show a loginscreen or something (I dont know, because its the first time I (try to) use the app.)
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Download from F-Droid
2. Install
3. Try to launch

### Environment data
Android version: 9

Device model: A001 (OnePlus One)

title: [Camera Uploads] Sync/Upload for older file, which waits for WiFi too
body:
During sync, only newer files are handled, but files which were not uploaded because of missing and required WiFi are postponed currently **for ever**.

My mobile becomes wet and I missed a lot of pictures from the last year, because of this bug. 👎  
I hope this bugfix is working like expected, please give it a try. At least my tests were positive

### BUGS & IMPROVEMENTS:

- [x] (1) Double notification when uploading a file: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2679#issuecomment-550198312 [FIXED WITH LATEST CHANGES]
- [x] (2) Does not retry if wifi is recovered with the app closed https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2679#issuecomment-554320203

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Restore option to move files upon manual upload
body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
Restore the option to move files to the selected ownCloud directory upon uploading files.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
At least keep the file modification time when copying the files, if move is really not possible anymore.

**Additional context**
In previous versions of the app, when I selected files for upload, a question appeared where I could select whether I want to copy or move the files into the local ownCloud directory on the phone. Most often I choose to move the files. It was a very handy feature, for example when I uploaded pictures, they appeared in the exact same space in the Gallery (as their modification dates were the same); then I could easily delete the uploaded files from the Gallery.

Now if I upload a number of pictures, I don't get any question about whether I want to copy or move them; they always get copied. Even worse, the modification date of the copies will be the actual date and not the original dates of the files. As result, all the uploaded pictures move up to present day in Gallery and it's chaos. Then I have a hard time pairing the original pictures to their uploaded copies if I want to delete the local copies to save space; as I don't upload all pictures, and I don't want to accidentally delete ones those are not uploaded.

Note: my actual ownCloud app version is 2.13 release 87ce8f0b7.


### TASKS

- [ ] Research removed code [here](#2479) and check if move option is still available
- [ ] Create branch feature/restore_move_option
- [ ] Development tasks
  - [ ] Add a new option to move files
  - [ ] Use ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT and delete file [docs](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/providers/document-provider.html#delete) once is uploaded to oC 
- [ ] Code review and apply changes requested
- [ ] Design test plan
- [ ] QA
- [ ] Merge branch feature/restore_move_option

### PR

- App
- Library (if needed)
